TransformStream.summary: The TransformStream interface of the Streams API represents a concrete implementation of the pipe chain transform stream concept.

remarks.para:
It may be passed to the method in order to transform a stream of data from one format into another.
For example, it might be used to decode (or encode) video frames, decompress data, or convert the stream from XML to JSON.

A transformation algorithm may be provided as an optional argument to the object constructor.
If not supplied, data is not modified when piped through the stream.

TransformStreamReadable.summary: The readable read-only property of the interface returns the instance controlled by this TransformStream.

TransformStreamTransformStream.summary: The TransformStream() constructor creates a new object which represents a pair of streams: a representing the writable side, and a representing the readable side.

TransformStreamWritable.summary: The writable read-only property of the interface returns the instance controlled by this TransformStream.
